alert.note: Alert for Colfax; Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 6:59AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, Colfax and Mora. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain fell overnight as thunderstorms trained in succession over the same area. The heaviest rain has ended, and flood waters should be receding, but minor flooding will probably continue until mid morning. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen along and just south of Highway 64 from the Raton Crews Airport to the Philmont Scout Ranch and Cooks Peak Burn Scar. This area will be especially susceptible to flash flooding again if more storms cross this afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cimarron, Maxwell, Philmont Scout Ranch, Raton Crews Airport, Miami, Rayado, and the Cooks Peak Burn Scar. - This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 307 and 339. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 418 and 442. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
